name: Paella on the Grill
description: A Spanish rice dish cooked on the grill with chicken, shrimp, clams, chorizo, and saffron.

ingredients.item: 1 ½ pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs
ingredients.name: boneless, skinless chicken thighs

ingredients.item: 12 ounces jumbo shrimp (16 to 20 per pound)
ingredients.name: jumbo shrimp (16 to 20 per pound)

ingredients.item: ½ cup Jarred Roasted Red Peppers, chopped fine
ingredients.name: Jarred Roasted Red Peppers, chopped fine

instructions: Mise en Place:
Charcoal Grill
For a Charcoal Grill: Open bottom vent completely.
Light large chimney starter mounded with charcoal briquettes (7 quarts).
When top coals are partially covered with ash, pour evenly over grill.
Using tongs, arrange 20 unlit briquettes evenly over coals.
Set cooking grate in place, cover, and open lid vent completely.
Heat grill until hot, about 5 minutes.
Chicken
Half crosswise 1½ pounds of chicken breast and place on plate in one layer.
Season both sides with salt and pepper.
Refrigerate until ready.
Shrimp
Peel and devein 12 ounces of shrimp. Put Shrimp in Large bowl.
Mince 6 cloves of garlic.
Measure ½ teaspoon of garlic and put into large bowl with shrimp.
Put remaining garlic in ramekin and reserve for sofrito.
Measure 1 Tablespoon olive oil, ¼ teaspoon paprika, and ¼ teaspoon salt in large bowl with shrimp
Toss to combine ingredients and refrigerate until ready
Linguica/chorizo
Cut 1 pound of linguica into ½ in slices and put in a regular bowl in the fridge.
Clams
Scrub 2 pounds of littleneck clams and put into large bowl of cold water.
Sofrito
Measure 1 Tablespoon of olive oil and put in medium saucepan.
Measure 1½ teaspoons of paprika and 3 Tablespoons of tomato pyaste. Put in ramekin.
Measure ⅔ cup dry sherry and put in pourable container.
Locate and set aside saffron container next to sherry by the range.
Open Chicken Broth and clamjuice containers and set aside by the sherry.
I Paella Vegetables
measure 1 cup of frozen peas out of the freezer and put into ramekin.
Leave peas out to thaw.
Finely chop 1 onion.
Finely chop enough roasted red to make ½ cup.
Paella Rice
Measure 3 cups of paella rice and put in large container.
fill up the container with water to the level of the rice.
Agitate the rice so the water becomes cloudy and drain.
Repeat steps 1-3 2 more times for 3 total rinses of the rice.
Measure 4 Tablespoons of Olive oil and put into pourable container.
Leave olive oil container out to help oil the grill later.
Measure ½ teaspoon of salt and put into small ramekin.
Cut desired amount of lemon wedges for serving.
Sofrito
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in medium saucepan over medium heat until shimmering.
Add remaining garlic and cook, stirring constantly, until garlic sticks to bottom of saucepan and begins to brown, about 1 minute.
Add tomato paste and remaining 1½ teaspoons paprika and continue to cook, stirring constantly, until dark brown bits form on bottom of saucepan, about 1 minute.
Add broth, clam juice, sherry, and saffron, if using. Increase heat to high and bring to boil. Remove saucepan from heat and set aside.
Chicken
Clean and oil cooking grate.
Place chicken on grill and cook until both sides are lightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes total.
Return chicken to plate.
Clean cooking grate.
Paella
Place roasting pan on grill and add remaining ¼ cup oil.
When oil begins to shimmer, add onion, red peppers, and ½ teaspoon salt.
Cook, stirring frequently, until onion begins to brown, 4 to 7 minutes.
Add rice and stir until grains are well coated with oil.
Arrange chicken around perimeter of pan.
Pour broth mixture and any accumulated juices from chicken over rice.
Smooth rice into even layer, making sure nothing sticks to the sides of the pan and no rice rests atop chicken.
When liquid reaches gentle simmer, place shrimp in center of pan in single layer.
Arrange clams in center of pan, evenly distributing with shrimp and pushing hinge sides of clams into rice slightly so they stand up.
Distribute chorizo evenly over the surface of rice.
Cook, moving and rotating pan to maintain gentle simmer across entire surface of pan, until rice is almost cooked through; about 12 to 18 minutes.
Sprinkle peas evenly over paella.
Cover grill, and cook until liquid is fully absorbed and rice on bottom of pan sizzles, 5 to 8 minutes.

Continue to cook, uncovered, checking bottom of pan frequently with metal spoon, until uniform golden-brown crust forms, 8 to 15 minutes longer. (Rotate and slide pan around grill as necessary to ensure even crust formation.)
Remove pan from grill, cover with aluminum foil, and let stand for 10 minutes.
Serve with lemon wedges.
